approve(address,uint256).details: allow another account/contract to spend some tokens on your behalf throws on any error rather then return a false flag to minimize user errors  also, to minimize the risk of the approve/transferFrom attack vector (see https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YLPtQxZu1UAvO9cZ1O2RPXBbT0mooh4DYKjA_jp-RLM/), approve has to be called twice in 2 separate transactions - once to change the allowance to 0 and secondly to change it to the new allowance value
approve(address,uint256).return: true if the approval was successful, false if it wasn't

transfer(address,uint256).details: send coins throws on any error rather then return a false flag to minimize user errors
transfer(address,uint256).return: true if the transfer was successful, false if it wasn't

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: an account/contract attempts to get the coins throws on any error rather then return a false flag to minimize user errors
transferFrom(address,address,uint256).return: true if the transfer was successful, false if it wasn't
